title: Damar Hamlin wants to raise awareness for this rare cardiac condition
description: Commotio cordis is the leading cause of death in youth athletes across all sports. He wants to change that.

title: McCarthy's bill for the looming debit limit would slash federal spending
description: Speaker McCarthy's proposal would lift the nation's credit limit for one year in exchange for spending cuts.

title: The race to protect people from dangerous glacial lakes
description: An estimated 15 million people are threatened by floods that happen when glaciers melt rapidly. Nepal's Himalayan communities are on the front lines.

title: Supreme Court extends freeze on changes to abortion pill access until Friday
description: The announcement kicks the can down the road on what the high court will do for another few days. Mifepristone is used in about half of all abortions nationwide.

title: Residents in Khartoum live in fear and desperation as fighting rages on
description: As rival military factions fight on the streets of Sudan's capital, three women describe what life is like for them. "I think we can die at any time. Nobody can feel safe in Khartoum now," one says.

title: Generic abortion pill manufacturer sues FDA in effort to preserve access
description: GenBioPro, which makes a generic form of mifepristone, is suing the FDA seeking to preserve access to the drug amidst ongoing federal litigation.

title: 2 teens charged with murder in Alabama shooting that left 4 dead and dozens injured
description: The suspects, 16 and 17, were arrested in connection with the shooting at a Sweet Sixteen birthday party, investigators said Wednesday. The district attorney said the two would be tried as adults.

title: 12 are arrested after a Beijing hospital fire killed 29 people
description: A dozen people have been arrested after a hospital fire in Beijing killed 29 people. Chinese netizens question why they weren't informed immediately.

title: Charles Stanley, whose Christian broadcasts spanned the world, dies at 90
description: His "In Touch with Dr. Charles Stanley," a Christian teaching program, first aired on the Christian Broadcasting Network in 1978. He was senior pastor of First Baptist Church of Atlanta for 50 years.

title: 2 Texas cheerleaders were shot after 1 tried to get in the wrong car after practice
description: The shooting happened just after midnight in the grocery store parking lot the cheerleaders use when carpooling to practice. One of them, described as an all-star cheer icon, was critically injured.

title: As pandemic emergencies end, some patients with long COVID feel 'swept under the rug'
description: Millions of Americans suffer from long COVID, which can have debilitating physical effects, including fatigue and difficulty breathing. Yet many patients feel abandoned, as federal aid winds down.

title: Florida's abortion laws protect a pregnant person's life, but not for mental health
description: If a pregnant person is struggling with mental health and considering suicide, several states' laws, including Florida's, specifically say the "life of the mother" exception does not apply to them.

title: Epic drought in Taiwan pits farmers against high-tech factories for water
description: The island is facing one of its worst dry spells in a century, and both the agricultural and high-tech sectors are competing for scarce water resources.

title: In 'The New Earth,' a family's pain echoes America's suffering
description: Jess Row's new novel is about an American family that has imploded, one that's broken, possibly irretrievably. It's a stunning book, a high-wire balancing act that tries to do a lot — and succeeds.

title: 'Leave pity city,' MillerKnoll CEO tells staff who asked whether they'd lose bonuses
description: In a leaked video that's spreading on social media, the head of a furniture giant tells her staff to focus on being better employees instead of worrying about their own financial futures.

title: As schools face calls to drop Native American mascots, some could lose state money
description: New York on Tuesday became the latest state in the nation to move to force schools to do away with the use of Native American team names or mascots. Those that don't comply risk losing their funding.

title: 4 are killed in a Maine home and 3 others are wounded in a linked highway shooting
description: Four people were fatally shot at a Maine house on Tuesday shortly before gunfire wounded three others on a highway, in crimes that are linked, authorities said. A man was charged with murder.

title: There are even more 2020 election defamation suits beyond the Fox-Dominion case
description: In addition to the Dominion case against Fox News, more than a dozen similar cases related to lies spread about the 2020 election are slowly making their way through the legal system.

title: Tyre Nichols' family plans to sue the Memphis police force, the officers and the city
description: The family's attorneys say they also intend to sue Memphis police for "intentional infliction of emotional distress for lying to [Tyre Nichols'] mother" about his beating at the hands of police.

title: Some Republicans say New York is in the grips of a crime wave. Experts say not at all
description: Earlier this week the House Judiciary Committee held a hearing in Manhattan about New York City's crime problem. But experts say, there is no problem.

title: Rural grocery stores are dying. Here's how some small towns are trying to save them
description: When a town loses its grocery store, it also lose a local source of healthy food and a place for neighbors to gather and connect. But some communities are finding innovative ways to keep shops open.

title: The Supreme Court ponders when a threat is really a 'true threat'
description: The court hears arguments Wednesday in a case that looks at whether the prosecution has to show that the defendant frightened his target intentionally.

title: Utah is in a state of emergency as melting snow is likely to cause months of flooding
description: The state experienced record snowfall last winter, and as snow melts, it could cause natural disasters, such as avalanches and mudslides, Gov. Spencer Cox says.

title: A coroner rules the singer Aaron Carter drowned in a tub from sedatives and inhalant
description: Aaron Carter, the younger brother of the Backstreet Boys' Nick Carter, was found submerged and dead at age 34 in the bathtub of his home in Lancaster, California, last November.

title: Multiple torch-carrying marchers in the Charlottesville rally are indicted
description: Nearly six years after white nationalists in Virginia clashed with counter-protesters, a grand jury indicted multiple people on felony charges for carrying flaming torches intended to intimidate.

title: 1 person is dead after a parking garage collapses in New York City
description: A parking garage collapsed Tuesday in lower Manhattan's Financial District, killing one worker, injuring five and crushing cars as concrete floors fell on top of each other, officials said.

title: Musician Pras Michel undergoes withering cross examination about foreign money
description: Pras Michel faces several federal criminal charges stemming from money he accepted from a fugitive billionaire, allegedly seeking to win access to the White House.
